title: The Week of Ursula Rivera: Educator by Day, Hero by Night
summary: Ursula Rivera, a 48-year-old teacher, discovers her superpower of manipulating time to teach and protect her community over the course of a week.
summaryGerman: Ursula Rivera, eine 48-jährige Lehrerin, entdeckt im Laufe einer Woche ihre Superkraft, die Zeit zu manipulieren, um zu lehren und ihre Gemeinde zu schützen.
summaryDutch: Ursula Rivera, een 48-jarige lerares, ontdekt haar superkracht om tijd te manipuleren om gedurende een week te onderwijzen en haar gemeenschap te beschermen.
summaryFrench: Ursula Rivera, une enseignante de 48 ans, découvre son superpouvoir de manipuler le temps pour enseigner et protéger sa communauté au cours d'une semaine.

story.text: Ursula Rivera begins her week feeling energetic as she prepares her lesson plans, unaware of the strange glowing object in her briefcase.
Ursula touches the glowing artifact, and time freezes around her. She spends the day experimenting with her newfound powers, feeling a mix of eerie and triumphant.
Now mastering her abilities, Ursula uses her power to extend time, helping struggling students understand complex topics, feeling deeply peaceful.
Ursula confronts a local crisis, stopping a disaster before it happens. The community remains unaware of their hero, but Ursula feels triumphant and happy.
With her powers becoming public knowledge, Ursula teaches her students about responsibility and power, bringing a romantic and epic closure to their week.
Ursula spends a day out, reflecting on her new role and responsibilities, feeling a serene blend of energy and peace.
Ursula prepares for the upcoming week, determined to balance teaching and heroism, feeling sad about the potential risks but hopeful.

ending: In the quiet moments of the night, Ursula Rivera looked to the stars, ready to educate and protect, ever the guardian of her community.
moral: With great power comes the responsibility to teach and protect.
